sectionText: German 211 and German 212 are sequenced, advanced German language courses that aim to help students develop greater ease and sophistication in their oral and written expression in German. German 211 covers past and contemporary issues of the German-speaking world, including: travel and leisure; literature, art, and music; environmental issues and politics; and migration and multiculturalism. Students will also read Thomas Brussig?s 1999 novel Am kï¿½rzeren Ende der Sonnenallee to develop interpretative skills in German and deepened cultural knowledge of Germany?s past, specifically East Germany during the 1970?s.
